snippet: Over four decades, at least 50 priests and other church employees molested hundreds of children in a small Roman Catholic diocese in central Pennsylvania, according to a grand jury report.
abstract: Pennsylvania grand jury reports at least 50 priests and other church employees molested hundreds of children over 40 years in small Roman Catholic diocese in central part of state; grand jury finds superiors were aware of abuses in many instances but did not remove priests or notify police.

byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and LAURIE GOODSTEIN

lead_paragraph: Over four decades, at least 50 priests and other church employees molested hundreds of children in a small Roman Catholic diocese in central Pennsylvania, according to a grand jury report.

headline.main: Pennsylvania Diocese Leaders Knew of Sex Abuse for Decades, Grand Jury Says
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania Diocese Leaders Knew of Abuse for Decades, Grand Jury Says
